intro: Silene petersonii, commonly known as Peterson's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers bloom in late summer. Silene petersonii is considered a rare and endemic species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
